Arsenal and Bayern Munich slapped with hefty fines over pitch invasion and missile throwing incidents 
Both clubs reprimanded by Uefa after separate incidents of fan trouble in Champions League clash By Gary Stonehouse Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL and Bayern Munich have been hit with Uefa fines following their Champions League clash earlier this month. 
The Gunners will have to fork out £4,300 after a pitch invader evaded security staff midway through the second half of the second leg at the Emirates. PA:Press Association 4 Arsenal have been hit with a Uefa fine after a pitch invader entered the field against Bayern Munich 
Bayern will also have to pay £2,600 after their supporters threw objects onto the pitch during their 5-1 victory . 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The travelling German fans bombarded the pitch with toilet rolls prior to kick off in north London. 
It was an organised protest against ticket prices at their own stadium. Uefa confirmed the news via a short statement. 
It read: “Match: UEFA Champions League round of 16 match between Arsenal FC and FC Bayern München (1-5), played on 7 March in London, England Getty Images The Gunners will have to pay £4,300 after the individual evaded security to enter the field Reuters Bayern Munich have also been reprimanded after their fans bombarded the Emirates pitch with toilet roll News Group Newspapers Ltd Bayern Munich defender Rafinha helps to clear toilet roll from the pitch 
“Decision: The CEDB has decided to fine Arsenal FC €5,000 and FC Bayern München €3,000 
“The charges against Arsenal FC were related to the field invasions by supporters – Art. 16 (2) of the UEFA Disciplinary Regulations (DR) 
“The charges against FC Bayern München were related to the throwing of objects – Art. 16 (2) DR.” Bayern fans throw hundreds of toilets rolls onto the Arsenal pitch
